data.text: @TheDohertyInst @afran_org @BurnetInstitute @UniMelb @UniMelbMDHS @TheRMH Important to have children & adolescent needs acknowledged & addressed- one of the most devastating aspects of the pandemic has been on children. This is why the needs of children have to be factored in to all responses & policy decisions. https://t.co/3mrg8F4SgD

Some invaluable lessons from @livingposvic CEO Richard Keane: adaptation of service delivery models, e-health opportunities, virtual forums and in-language information is crucial for health literacy and equity. #AIID

Associate Professor David Anderson highlights the importance of research collaborations and commercial partnerships in developing adaptive point of care test solutions. @BurnetInstitute #AIID https://t.co/OZ20goz4k8

@TheDohertyInst Did you sign our rights over to 
B    ill  Gates during Pandemics??

Yes or No??

🤬
Community engagement is critical in the pandemic response and the Optimise Study has provided platform for this. @BurnetInstitute #AIID https://t.co/0gY3kPpDOo

In addition to longitudinal surveys, the Optimise Study has implemented snapshot surveys to understand issues in real-time, like the introduction of RATs for surveillance in schools. @BurnetInstitute #AIID

Professor Margaret Hellard outlines the Optimise Study, Which aims to find out how Victorians are experiencing COVID-19 and responding to the measures introduced to stop the spread of the virus. @BurnetInstitute #AIID https://t.co/nAYjsl4rXl

An important focus has been strengthening equitable access to public health pathogen genomics in the Asia Pacific region, utilising partnerships like @COMBAT_AMR_ and @FlemingFund to build capacity and establish referral networks. @norelle_sherry #AIID

Prior to COVID, a national need for a data sharing tool to support public health laboratories performing genomic sequencing. #AusTrakka was conceptualised and fast tracked during the pandemic underpinned by @CDGN_Australia - @norelle_sherry on tracking the pandemic
